intro: Colobanthus lechleri, commonly known as the Andean morning glory, is a flowering plant native to the high Andes of South America. It is a member of the Convolvulaceae family and is characterized by its trailing growth habit and vibrant, trumpet-shaped flowers. The plant produces small, round, yellow fruits that contain numerous seeds. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in cloud forests. Due to its ornamental value and traditional uses, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens.
